postQuizHtml:
If you want to learn more about the galaxy, I recommend you check out this page on National Geographic's website:

Origins of the Universe 101

questionPools.feedbackOnUpgradeHtml: Great work! Now we're going to check out outer space... watch this video on galaxies before continuing to the next section!
questionPools.feedbackOnDowngradeHtml: Dang! Review the Solar System 101 Video, then try again! Nice try though.

questions.questionHtml:
How many planets does our solar system have?
[Please note that Coloured feedback is OFF for this quiz.]
questions.hintHtml: One was demoted to "dwarf planet" recently!
questions.feedbackForPerfect:
There are actually 8 planets. Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune!

Pluto used to be classified as a planet, but is now considered a dwarf planet.
questions.feedbackForImperfect:
There are actually 8 planets. Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune!

Pluto used to be classified as a planet, but is now considered a dwarf planet.

questions.questionHtml:
The largest moon in our solar system has an atmosphere that is denser than the atmosphere of Mars. The name of this moon is:

[Please note that Coloured feedback is OFF for this quiz.]

Place a checkmark beside the Gas Giant the planets.

[Please note that Coloured feedback is OFF for this quiz.]
questions.feedbackForPerfect: Correct! The rocky planets are Earth, Mercury, Venus, and Mars. Jupiter, Neptune, Saturn, and Uranus are all gas giants.
questions.feedbackForImperfect: The rocky planets are Earth, Mercury, Venus, and Mars. Jupiter, Neptune, Saturn, and Uranus are all gas giants.
